sections.heading: public; disqualified; when.A notary public is disqualified from performing a notarial act as authorized by Chapter 64, articles 1 and 2, if the notary:(1) Is a spouse, ancestor, descendant, or sibling of the principal, including in-law, step, or half relatives;(2) Except in the performance of duties
sections.text: public; disqualified; when.A notary public is disqualified from performing a notarial act as authorized by Chapter 64, articles 1 and 2, if the notary:(1) Is a spouse, ancestor, descendant, or sibling of the principal, including in-law, step, or half relatives;(2) Except in the performance of duties pursuant to sections 64-211 to 64-215, has a financial or beneficial interest in the transaction other than receipt of the ordinary notarial fee or is individually named as a party to the transaction; or(3) Does not understand the acknowledgment or notarial certificate used to certify the performance of his or her duties.SourceLaws 2004, LB 315, ยง 7;Laws 2012, LB398, ยง 4.

64-105.01.Notary public; disqualified; when.

A notary public is disqualified from performing a notarial act as authorized by Chapter 64, articles 1 and 2, if the notary:

(1) Is a spouse, ancestor, descendant, or sibling of the principal, including in-law, step, or half relatives;

(2) Except in the performance of duties pursuant to sections 64-211 to 64-215, has a financial or beneficial interest in the transaction other than receipt of the ordinary notarial fee or is individually named as a party to the transaction; or

(3) Does not understand the acknowledgment or notarial certificate used to certify the performance of his or her duties.

SourceLaws 2004, LB 315, ยง 7;Laws 2012, LB398, ยง 4.
